visual_cues.description: Identifies the object's overall form to determine how it should be cut.
Determines the dimensions of the object to select an appropriate cutting tool and technique.
Helps identify whether the object is hard, soft, or slippery, influencing cutting pressure and tool choice.
Distinguishes objects visually and identifies areas to be cut.
Visible patterns or markings that indicate where cuts should be made.
The visible edge of the object to ensure precise cutting along boundaries.
Transparency or translucency helps assess the object's interior properties.
The perceived bulk of the object helps adjust cutting depth and force.
The location of the object relative to the cutting tool and surface.
examples: Object centered on a cutting board
Edge of a vegetable hanging off the board

visual_cues.description: Visual distinction between the object and its surroundings to enhance visibility.
examples: Bright red tomato on a white cutting board
Dark chocolate on a light counter
